results.name: Least k such that 2*n*k - 1 is a prime.
comment: Question: Is the sequence unbounded (like A016014)? - _Dmitry Kamenetsky_, Oct 26 2016

Answer: Yes. Essentially the same argument works. To get n such that a(n) > K, take distinct odd primes p_k, k=1..K with p_k not dividing k, and take n such that n == (2*k)^(-1) mod p_k and 2*k*n-1 > p_k for k=1..K. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 27 2016
link: Dmitry Kamenetsky, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Do[k = 1; cp = n*k - 1; While[ ! PrimeQ[cp], k++; cp = n*k - 1]; Print[k], {n, 2, 400, 2}]
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(k=1); while (!isprime(2*n*k-1), k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 27 2016
